A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
As someone who knows way more about Star Wars than how to talk to women\, it brings me no joy in saying I was let down thoroughly by this film. 

Why it maintains all the great things about the Star Wars universe that we've grown to love in it's charismatic characters and stunning visuals\, 'The Last Jedi' decides to flip off fans by laughing at the notion that the main story points we were promised would be resolved in 'The Force Awakens' ever actually mattered. 

The performances are solid to great at times\, and the narrative is not at fault at all. It simply comes down to Rian Johnson finding it hilarious that we ever cared at any point about these new characters or where they were going\, and insisting that the true story to be told here is all about how anyone can be a hero. Also\, you need to spell Rian with a "y" instead of an "i" bro. 

To listen to our thoughts on Luke milking the titty of a space manatee and drinking it immediately\, head on over to broforcesquad.com.
